runs.comm: back of a length, angling across. Porterfield dabs it away towards third man, off the outside half of his bat
full outside off, nice stride forward to defend to mid-off
length ball outside off, eased away through cover point. Just leaned on it and presented a straight bat
back of a length on off stump, blocked back to the bowler off the back foot
back of a length, angling in towards off stump, blocked to short cover
ball! That was a little fuller than the previous one, and it caught Stirling half forward, and straightened to take his outside edge down to third man. He was looking to push that down the ground
fullish, angling across and swinging back a bit towards off stump. Stirling plays a good-looking checked drive to mid-off
back of a length, again shapes in towards off and middle, punched to short cover
length ball outside off, looks to slap it through extra cover, and the swing forces him to hit it straighter, to mid-off

got him! That is superb bowling from Guruge, slanted this across and this time there was no swing. Stirling stood there and flashed at it away from his body, and could only nick it through to the keeper
length ball, angling in towards middle and off, defended solidly towards mid-on
back of a length on off stump, punched crisply to the left of short cover
back of a length, angling away outside off, left alone
a bit fuller, closer to off stump, and Porterfield blocks it back down the ground
full, inviting the drive outside off, swung in a touch and beat the inside edge of his flashing bat
fullish, in a tight line on the corridor, and that surely wasn't an easy leave for Porterfield, who had seen the previous one swing into him
a bit of shape in again, this time from a straighter line and shorter length and raps him on the thigh pad as he looks to work it into the leg side
slanted across again, fifth-stump line, easier leave for Porterfield
back of a length on off stump, blocked into the covers
fuller, a bit of shape away from off stump, driven firmly back to the bowler
on middle stump now, checked drive to the left of mid-on
beauty, late curl away from a fourth-stump line, good leave from Porterfield

good ball, angling in towards off stump on a fullish length, and he has to play very late because he isn't sure if it's going with the angle or shaping away. Goes with the angle and he defends towards mid-on
short and wide now, releases some of the pressure, slapped away past backward point
back of a length on off stump, goes back and across to block it back to the bowler
a bit of width now and he can stand there and carve it down to third man
lovely length there, Joyce's feet are stuck and he pushes at it and the angle causes it to beat his edge
short ball and Joyce goes for the pull with his weight on the front foot, scoops it high in the air, but drops down in no-man's land two-thirds of the way to the forward square leg boundary
back of a length, angling across, slapped to backward point
length ball close to off stump. Joyce stays on the back foot and prods it away towards point
ooh. He wasn't fully forward to this one, which threatened to shape away but didn't swing as much as the batsman expected. Pushed away from his body and inside-edged it onto his front pad
fuller, angled into middle stump, defended with a straight bat to short midwicket
full on off stump, Porterfield checks his drive to mid-on
length ball, goes with the angle towards off stump, defended to short cover
again, lovely length, fourth-stump line, brings Porterfield forward to defend back to the bowler
fullish on middle stump, and Porterfield was playing for swing there, looking to clip through midwicket. Went with the angle and he inside-edged it to fine leg
fullish, angled across, punchy checked drive to the right of mid-off
shortish outside off, gets a bit of extra bounce as he waves his bat at it to punch it through cover point, goes off the outside half of his bat towards third man
back of a length close to off stump, punched to the right of mid-off
short ball, poor ball, Joyce middles the pull perfectly this time, is in a much better position, weight transferred onto the back foot, and it races away to the midwicket boundary
fuller now, fifth-stump line, inviting Joyce to play another aggressive shot. He politely declines the invitation
another length ball angling away, a little fuller than the previous one, another leave from Joyce.
fullish, angling in towards off and middle, blocked down the ground towards mid-on
length ball on middle stump, clipped to short midwicket
nice shot. That was curling away from him and not quite driving length, but he got a big stride out and got his head over the ball to drive to the left of short cover

whoah, another miscue lands in no-man's land. Went for another cover drive, this time he was leaning back a bit, I think it was the slower ball and he was through his shot early, and it swung away and he sliced it high over point but he couldn't quite get to it in time, running back towards the boundary
length ball on middle and leg, pushed down to mid-on
length ball, a bit of nibble away, Joyce leaves it safely alone
full, a bit of swing in towards middle and off, driven down to mid-off

fullish, wide outside off and he sliced it towards point and went for the single. Sent back, and a bit of a hairy moment as Rohan Mustafa sends in a good throw, off balance, but he's regained his ground safely enough and the keeper can't quite deflect it into the stumps
not short enough to pull, and he's lucky that beat him outside off, and that he didn't nick behind or chop it on

shot! That made such a crisp sound as it went off the bat. It was just a touch too full, and the angle gave him enough room to lean forward and flat-bat that on top of the bounce to send it screaming away through square cover

back of a length now, punched to extra cover, and oh my, that's totally unnecessary. The fielder throws looking for the keeper, and sends it soaring over his head and gives away an overthrow. Saqlain, the substitute fielder.
fuller now and he gets on the front foot to drive between cover and mid-off
length ball angling in towards off stump, straightens a touch. Lets it come on and guides it to short third man
a little wider outside off now, and Joyce leaves that for the keeper
length ball just outside off, blocked into the covers
on the pads, the first time Guruge has strayed in that direction, and it's clipped away wide of midwicket
back to a good length outside off, defended solidly into the covers
fullish on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
length ball on middle and off, blocked back towards the non-striker
fourth-stump line this time, nice angle across, defended into the covers
a touch closer to off stump now, presses forward to defend

bowled him! Or is it? Oh man. That was the yorker on off stump, and it hurried through Joyce before he could bring his bat down. Hit the side of off stump, the off bail went off its groove, all lit up, only to land back in it. How unlucky is that?
now it's full and straight, on middle and off, and he presents a nice full face and drives it back down the ground, between the stumps and the non-striker. Rubbing it in Javed's face, Joyce is.
on the pads now, can't get his bat around in time to flick, ricochets off the side of the front pad into the leg side
back of a length outside off, punched to the right of short cover
full outside off, driven down to mid-off
back of a length outside off, dabbed to short third man, who makes a good stop, diving to his right. It was the captain Tauqir, all 43 years of him
length ball angling into middle stump, lets it come on and clips it just wide of mid-on
back of a length outside off, dabbed to short third man. More of a defensive shot than the previous one, which was an attempt to find the gap
length ball on a fifth-stump line, comes forward and plays a checked drive to sweeper cover
full, swinging in towards middle stump, driven to mid-on
full outside off, a tiny bit of shape in, driven firmly to mid-off
full-toss on middle stump, punched down to mid-on
length ball outside off, flat-batted to the right of mid-off
very full, this time it swings away a touch and he opens his bat face and jabs it away through point
fullish on middle and off, blocked to mid-off
length ball, angling in towards off stump, bunted with soft hands into the off side, and backward point is quicker to it than short cover, despite the latter being closer to it

and again, a miscue into unoccupied territory. He's down the track now and he takes that from outside off and shovels it miles in the air, over mid-on and falls just beyond his reach as he runs back to try and catch it
length ball on off stump, blocked into the covers

slower ball just outside off, comes forward, lets it come on, and dabs it a short distance from him, and point makes a mess of an attempt to backhand it into the stumps after a desperate sprint to the ball
back of a length on off stump, guided down to third man
rare bad ball from Guruge, looks for the full, straight one and slides it down the leg side
fullish on middle stump, defended to mid-on
length ball on off stump, defended towards point
lovely length, homing in on the top of off stump, and Joyce defends into the covers
fullish, just wide enough of off stump to give Joyce room to swing his arms through and loft down the ground, over mid-off
genuine width this time, but he has protection on the cover point boundary to keep that flat-batted slap down to a single
full outside off and he flows into a lovely drive to the left of cover. This is a good over for Ireland, they're finding a bit of momentum now
length ball outside off, eased away to sweeper cover
tossed up outside off, driven to short extra cover
a little straighter now, drives this to long-off
better length, brings him forward and elicits an lbw appeal as it goes with the angle and hits his front pad. Inside-edge on that
length ball outside off, pushed into the covers
again it goes through with the angle, this time Joyce kept his front pad out of the way to defend
another slider, starts from outside off this time, and he pokes it away into the covers
back of a length outside off, punched off the back foot to point
fullish on middle and off, pushed back to the bowler
full and wide, driven past point, who didn't make the greatest of efforts to stop that, diving to his left
fullish on off stump, driven down to long-off
full and wide, driven to sweeper cover

on middle stump now and he clips it to mid-on and is a little late deciding to take the single. No direct hit, or it might have been interesting at the bowler's end. He would have been a couple of inches short of his crease.
dropped! Down the track looking to chip it over the bowler. Got too close to it and ended up hitting it just over his right shoulder. He stuck his right hand out and it simply didn't stick
makes some room while stepping down the track, pushes it into the covers
back of a length, a bit of extra bounce as he looks to work it through the leg side, pops off the leading edge towards short third man
beauty. Beats Porterfield in the air, dips and turns past his outside edge as he comes forward to drive. Keeper didn't collect cleanly, ricocheted off his gloves towards fine leg
down the track now, hits it in the air down to long-on
fullish on off stump, driven to extra cover
back of a length on middle and off. Stays inside the line and uses the angle to dab it to third man, where a fumble from Guruge allows an easy second run

fullish on off stump, poked towards point and they run despite hitting it pretty close to the fielder. Rohan is the fielder, and he would have been out had the throw hit the stumps at the bowler's end
short ball, pulled in the air, but falls short of deep square leg, who makes a good attempt diving forward
got him! Joyce's luck runs out finally, goes for a drive away from his body. It was a good ball, angling away, not full enough to drive, and the edge carries through at shoulder height to Patil
whooaa. That was slanted across invitingly for the big drive, and beat O'Brien, who went hard at it with no footwork
full on middle stump, blocked back to the bowler
length ball, straightening a touch towards off stump. Goes on the back foot to work it wide of midwicket
tossed up wide outside off and he doesn't get to the pitch to drive, slices it away between cover point and backward point
nice flight, a bit of drift in towards off stump, and he comes forward to dab it towards point
slips this down the leg side and O'Brien laps it away towards fine leg
beauty, dips and spins past the outside edge as Niall shapes to push through cover
this one doesn't turn as much as Niall expects as he presses forward to defend, hits the inside half of his bat and drops a few feet in front of him
on the pads, and that's a bit of a gift, tucked away to the left of short fine leg
back of a length on off stump, dabbed away to backward point
fullish outside off, nice checked drive to sweeper cover
excellent delivery, that one left him just a touch from outside off and beat his outside edge. Did well to not follow that with his bat
full on middle stump, clipped to midwicket
short, angling across Niall, who leans away from the line and lets it go through to the keeper
tossed up on off stump, driven down to long-off
length ball, goes with the angle towards off stump, presses forward to poke that towards point
goes on the back foot and this stays with the angle again to cramp him, defended into the off side
runs down the track now and that's a nice shot, gets a full flow of the bat in to launch that down the ground, to the left of long-off
tossed up wider and he reaches out to slap that towards point
length ball outside off, and he goes back and across to whip it towards short midwicket
floated up towards middle stump and he gets his front pad out of the way to push that into the covers
tossed up on off and middle, driven past the diving bowler to long-off
length ball that goes with the angle towards off stump, dabbed towards backward point off the front foot
down the track, and that's a firmly hit drive to the right of long-off
in the blockhole on middle stump, gets his foot out of the way and pushes it to long-off
another fullish slider on middle stump, defended to extra cover
floated up outside off and he skips down the pitch to poke it away to sweeper cover
loopy delivery outside off, pushes out and drives to cover

bowled him! That hung in the air for a while and he played across it, looking to sweep. Cleared his front leg, and played across a straight ball, which went under his bat and crashed into middle stump
quickish length ball on off stump, defended into the covers
flat again, angled into middle stump, goes back and defends into the on side
a bit more air, goes back and across and punches it back to the bowler
slow, loopy delivery on off stump, driven inside-out to deep cover
length ball, angled in towards middle and leg, goes on the back foot to defend to straight midwicket
down the track now, gets to the pitch to drive to long-on
length ball, slides on towards off stump, goes back and punches to extra cover
quicker and fuller, stays deep in his crease and makes room to push that to sweeper cover
fullish, angling into the pads, played with a straight bat to straight midwicket
lots of flight outside off, inviting the drive. Niall ignores it

Tauqir strikes again! Niall has reviewed, but it looked plumb. It slid on again, towards middle stump, I would think. Went for the sweep across the line and that thudded into his front pad. Was there an edge? Nope. Didn't get a huge stride forward either. Hit him in line with middle stump, you can see off stump when it hit. Turned and straightened, in fact, and went past his outside edge. Hitting three-fourths of the way up middle stump, and Niall O'Brien will have to go.
slanted across towards off stump, straightens a touch, defended back to the bowler
goes for the sweep and there's some extra bounce on this, gloves it over the keeper. Risky stuff, this
beauty. That was tossed up, angling across the batsman, drifting away and carrying on to beat his outside edge as he looks to drive down the ground
a bit quicker and flatter and he's deep in his crease to defend towards extra cover
tossed up on middle and leg, skips down the track and clips it towards long-on
tossed up, turns in towards off stump, defended back down the ground
a bit flatter and quicker on a fourth-stump line, half-forward to punch back to the bowler
a bit straighter now and he can punch that down to long-on for one
down the track and he fires it into his feet, clips it away to deep midwicket
flattish length ball outside off, pushed with a straight bat to long-off
back of a length on off stump, punched down the ground and straight midwicket puts in an acrobatic dive to his left to stop it from going down to long-on
down the track, clips it to straight midwicket
looks to step out again and he bowls it quicker, not to the pitch and it turns past his bat to hit his front pad, strikes him outside the line
a bit slower and he comes forward to tuck it away through square leg. He's overstepped and the umpire signals for a free-hit
nicely done. Sends down an off-stump full-toss and quick hands get the reverse-slap away into the gap to the left of short third man
tossed up on middle stump, driven down to long-on
a bit of turn now, dips on the batsman outside off and comes in sharply, clipped towards midwicket
length ball on off stump, fairly quick and flat. Goes on the back foot to punch to straight midwicket
a bit of flight now and he's able to drive this straight, past the diving bowler down to long-on
turns into the pads and he can tuck it away to the right of the man at straight midwicket
down the track now, can't clip this away past straight midwicket
down the track again, gets inside the line this time to drive down to long-off
tossed up outside off, presses forward to block it back to the bowler
a touch short and he goes back to cut, beats Amjad Javed, who slips on the grass while trying to stop that at short third man
down the track now, whips it in the air but into the gap between long-on and deep midwicket
down the track again, drives down to long-on with a straight bat
nice bit of flight outside off, punched through the hands of the bowler, who doesn't make a great effort to bend down in his follow-through, and down to long-on
tossed up on off and middle, looks to work it with the turn past short fine leg, can't beat the fielder
back of a length, angling down leg, looks to flick it and it runs off the pad towards short fine leg
full on middle and leg, clipped to straight midwicket
down the track, meets this ball on the full, whips it to long-on
slow, tossed up delivery outside off, driven back to the bowler
length ball angling in towards off stump, driven down to long-on
back of a length, turning towards leg stump. Balbirnie looks to step away and make room but he's cramped by the turn and can only punch to straight midwicket
flight and turn from outside off. Comes forward to defend, off the inside half of the bat into the leg side, where square leg fails to stop the ball, diving to his right
nice flight again, and this time he steps out and gets to the pitch to drive to long-off
a different response to slow flight, goes deep in his crease and defends back towards the bowler
slow and loopy again, driven down to long-off, who sends in a flat throw and hits the stumps at the bowler's end
sees some air outside off and plays a positive shot, gets across to sweep powerfully to the forward square leg boundary
lovely loop, dips and turns in towards middle stump after he was initially looking to drive through the off side. Adjusts and moves his front pad out of the way to tuck it into the leg side
flat, angling in towards middle and leg. He was initially looking to make room, and can only squirt it defensively into the on side
shuffles across his crease now, clips this from off stump to the right of straight midwicket
flat, angled into the pads, worked to square leg
full-toss on off stump, punched to straight midwicket
a bit slower now, and it turns in from outside off, and again he punches it straight to straight midwicket
nice loop outside off but this time it's full enough to drive to long-off
back of a length outside off, slapped away to sweeper cover
shortish outside off, and it's cut away to that sweeper fielder again
length ball on off stump, driven down to long-off

short ball outside off. It moved away off the pitch, and kept a bit low as the batsman looked to pull, and he ended up chopping it down off the inside edge, past the keeper's right leg, and down to the boundary behind him
another slower short ball, pulled away to deep midwicket
slower ball, fuller this time, and he presses forward to dab it to backward point
length ball, angling in towards middle stump. Goes on the back foot to tuck it away to deep midwicket
down the track but he isn't at the pitch of the ball to drive, punches it back to the bowler
down the track again, a bit wider this time, driven into the covers
out of his crease once more, a bit of turn in, and it's off the inside edge towards backward square leg. Was looking to hit to long-on, maybe
low full-toss, clipped away past midwicket and deep midwicket has to dive to his left to stop it on the boundary

tossed up outside off, driven through extra cover. Good fielding by the man running across from long-off, and they go for a fourth, and a direct hit from the bowler, who moved towards extra cover to intercept the throw from the deep, might have had Balbirnie.
back of a length on off stump, punched to short cover
slower ball, full on off stump, jabbed down the ground to long-off
another slower ball, this time he gives the batsman some width, and Wilson steps away from the line and cuts it away, cracking shot to the right of backward point
makes room again, this one's banged in closer to off stump, Wilson pulls to deep midwicket
another slower ball, full on off stump, pushed down to long-off
sees him moving his back foot towards the leg side and bowls this slower one wide outside off. Goes for the slash, can't connect
back of a length, turning in towards off and middle, punched off the back foot to long-on
makes room to hit through the off side, turns in to cramp him, and he drags the pull to straight midwicket
down the track now, clipped down to long-on
very full on off stump, poked down to long-on
makes a lot of room to play the late cut from in front of middle stump, can't beat short third man
flat, angling in towards leg stump, pushed down to long-on
slower ball, angling down leg and following Wilson, who swivels to pull it round to deep backward square leg
shortish legcutter on off stump, nips away with extra bounce to beat the attempted cut
looks to make room and pull again, and he's through the shot a fortnight before the slower ball reaches him. Keeps low too, and he's lucky that doesn't hit off stump
another slower ball, on the pads, worked away between short fine leg and deep square leg. They take two but Wilson didn't complete his first run properly, the umpire indicates
another leg-roller on off stump, pushed down the ground to long-on
back of a length on off stump, punched down to long-on
fullish, a bit of width, driven away to the right of swepeer cover. He was slow getting to the ball and they run three
ball! That was back of a length, angling in sharply even as Wilson backed away to cut. Got too close to him and he couldn't put bat to ball

full now, angling in from wide of the crease. Steps away from the line and drives inside-out to sweeper cover. He's only two-thirds of the way back, and has a shorter distance to run to cut off the angle, and keeps it down to a single.
gone! It was a length ball on off stump and he moved away from the line to drive through extra cover. May have stopped on him a touch and he ended up spooning a simple catch to the fielder at mid-off
length ball, angling in towards off stump, punched firmly to mid-off
shortish, angling in, and he skips back and across and swivels quite fleet-footedly to half-pull, half-whip it away to the backward square leg boundary
back of a length on off stump, and he makes room to slap that away to the point boundary
in the blockhole, following Wilson who moves away from leg stump, poked down to long-on
good ball, a full, floaty slower ball following the batsman, attacking his feet as he backs away from leg stump. Goes for a big heave and it smacks him on the back leg
back of a length on off stump, flat-batted in the air down to long-on
again full and at the batsman's feet, clipped wide of long on for two to bring up his half-century
follows the batsman again, and he makes a bit more room to punch it down to long-on
full on middle stump, driven to mid-on
length ball on off stump and that is superbly done by Kev. Makes room, goes deep in his crease, and clubs it away between midwicket and mid-on

full on off stump and that is drilled down the ground, all bottom hand, through the bowler's hands, as he attempts to crouch and stop the ball, and wide of mid-off. This is superb ball-striking. The mid-off fielder has cramped up while trying to chase the ball. Saqlain.
waist-high full-toss, following the batsman as he backed away for room. Slapped to mid-off
and another, this one hits him high on the bat, on the sticker, and pops into an unguarded area on the leg side, as he swivels hurriedly to pull, and this one's a no-ball and a warning for the bowler
clears his front leg and swipes this firmly to midwicket, who fumbles but Kev isn't quick enough to pounce on the mistake and convert it into a single
short slower ball, pulled to midwicket
looks to bowl it slower, slips it down the leg side, and Wilson can't connect with the sweep
sweeps again, this time from an off-stump line down to deep square leg
short and wide and he makes a little bit of room to carve that up and over cover
full-toss, sticks his front leg across and scoops that over short fine leg. This is all too easy for Kevin O'Brien.
full now, on off stump, backs away and drives inside-out to the left of long-off
slower ball on off stump, steered away to the left of point

dropped! slower ball on middle stump, and Kev goes for the big heave down the ground and skies it high in the air. Nasir Aziz, the substitute fielder, moves to his left at long-on and was pretty much under it, a few feet in front of the boundary. Got into a poor position to catch it, leaning backwards with his hands in the air, and ended up palming it towards the boundary

another good slower ball, more luck for Ireland. Swings across the line and that juuust misses leg stump, and the keeper can't collect cleanly as he falls to his left to intercept the ball rolling towards him
low full-toss on off stump, jabbed towards mid-off
slower ball, short ball, he seemed to drag it down, and Kev clears his front leg and clubs it away over backward square leg
slower ball, angling into the pads. Kev doesn't connect with the flick, rolls off his front pad towards the keeper
excellent yorker, follows Kevin's backtracking feet and goes through to the keeper between his legs
quick and flat on middle stump and he reverse-sweeps to short third man
makes room and he drives it inside-out, from outside leg stump and into the extra cover boundary
down the leg side now and he sweeps it to short fine leg
down the track, whipped away to deep midwicket
full on leg stump, clears his front leg and smacks it down to long-off
down the track again and that is a superb shot from Wilson, clipping it in the air, into the gap between long-on and deep midwicket

slower ball on middle and leg, and that is a Kevin O'Brien special. Clears the front leg and swings through the line, swinging from the arms, using the swivel of his hips, and launches it way over the long-on boundary
another slower ball, this time Kev had stepped away from the line, swipes it to midwicket

whoa. That was full on off stump, ordinarily too full to get that sort of elevation, but he goes deep in his crease and whips his wrists through the ball, so much bottom-hand, and it's up and over long-off. Half-century up for him as well, off 24 balls!

gone! Another slower ball, and he was moving away from the line, looking to hit over extra cover. Doesn't connect half as well as he'd have liked to, and he scoops it straight into the fielder's hands
Full outside off, and Mooney's feet don't move too much as he plays and misses
wide of the crease, anging in, and it straightens from a length to beat Mooney's prod outside off stump

shot! That's back of a length, angling in towards middle stump. The angle makes the keeper move to his left, and Wilson made room and steered it away not far to the right of the space he had just vacated
short on off stump, slapped away to the left of sweeper cover
length ball, angling in towards off stump, hangs back and dabs it into the covers
on the pads, tucked away towards long leg
down the track, makes room, lifts this middle-stump ball up and over the covers. Lovely shot
full on middle and leg, clipped away to the left of deep midwicket
slower ball on a length outside off, slapped towards cover point
and he's beaten him three balls out of three. Length ball outside off, and it straightens just a touch. Mooney goes for the big hit over mid-off and is nowhere near connecting
full on leg stump, clipped away to long leg
back of a length outside off, and Wilson, coming down the track and making room, slashes and misses. The crowd goes 'ohhhhhh'.

plants his front foot across to lap-sweep, and Amjad hits him on the pad with a full one. Bit appeal as it rolls away towards short fine leg, not given. They've decided to review, but I think that struck him outside the line... wait, no! That hit him not on the pad but on the thigh, and that may well have been in line with off stump.  In line with off and middle, aaaaand... wait for it... clipping the bails! Umpire's call again! Not the first time this is happening at this World Cup. So much drama!
another twist. Mooney looks to lap-sweep a full ball on off stump, ends up hitting it awkwardly over his own shoulder, and Amjad Ali, backtracking from short fine leg, takes a well-judged catch
bad ball with mid-off in the circle. It's full and wide, and that's plenty of swinging room for Wilson to hit up and over that fielder

another one wide outside off, this one's a slower ball, and he hits that so hard it nearly decapitates the umpire, who falls to his right, out of the way, just in time. It went well over his head, on replay, but he still got into the crouching seagull position to get out of the way

and UAE are back in it! that's a short ball angling into his body, and he leans away to guide it past short third man, but he ends up hitting it too close to him, and Javed dives forward and takes a super low catch
back of a length, angling in, tucking him up for room. Looks to dab it past short third man, hits it straight to him
was that another drop? Not too much room for the cut and he sliced it to the left of backward point. Rohan Mustafa dived and, yup, it bounced a good six inches short of him

full now, angling into middle and leg. He pokes it towards short midwicket and they set off for the single. The fielder underarms it at the bowler;s end and misses, and that, I think, would have been out had he hit with a clean throw. He ended up flicking it out of his fingertips

and he produces the perfect yorker first ball. Base of middle stump, and he jabs it down the ground but can only hit the stumps at the other end. Bowler dived and nearly got a fingertip on it. Not sure if the non-striker was in his crease
length ball outside off, straightens a touch after pitching. Cusack swings at it with no footwork and is nowhere near connecting
low full-toss outside off, and he swings at it and swipes it away through square leg. Tauqir kicks it away while sliding to field it, and ends up conceding a second
slower ball, full, outside off, smacked back down the ground and it ricochets into the cover region off the bowler's palm
slower ball, and Dockrell has smashed that over extra cover. Wasn't a bad ball in theory, but he'd moved away from the line and was in the perfect position to swing his arms through that lofted drive
backs away and looks to work it away through the leg side and it moves in a touch and hits him on the front pad
backs away and slaps the full ball to mid-off. Goes for the single, and the throw from mid-off misses at the bowler's end. He was nowhere in the picture!

short ball, angling into the body, and Ireland have won it! He went for the uppercut, miscued it, but who cares? Cover turned around and hared back desperately to try and catch it, but that was always falling a long way away from him
